fields.description:
h3. Problem
Themes are set to "DEFAULT" when removing theme from the theme cell in the new UI. "DEFAULT" is an invalid value therefore causes an error when customers try to commit the change.

Error  message :  "Unable to commit the item's theme"


 !TEST1.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Themes set to "DEFAULT" when removing theme from the theme cell in the new UI

fields.description:
{panel:title=(i) Bug Fix Policy|titleBGColor=#e0efff}

At the moment, we can't set an ETA for the fix to be released, since there's a number of factors that determine how our product team prioritizes bugfixes.
 You can learn more by reading [Atlassian Cloud Bug Fixing Policy|https://confluence.atlassian.com/support/atlassian-cloud-bug-fixing-policy-206865884.html].
{panel}
h3. Issue Summary

The exported data from Jira Server stores "externalId" which doesn't correspond to the value in {{entities.xml}}.
 Consequently, affected users cannot be modified at [a team|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiraportfoliocloud/adding-and-removing-teams-and-team-members-828785272.html] of Portfolio for Jira (P4J) on cloud.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

The exact reproducible procedure is unknown:
 # Perform the site backup on Jira Server which has P4J's team having some users
 # Import the data to Jira Cloud

h3. Expected Results

P4J's team data can be migrated to Cloud.
h3. Actual Results

The data contained in the exported file are mismatched. AO_82B313_PERSON points to an incorrect value.
 * (/) entities.xml > User: {{externalId}}
 * (x) activeobject.xml > {{"string"}} value corresponding to ACCOUNT_ID of {{tableName="AO_82B313_PERSON"}}

h3. Workaround

Consider adding yourself as a watcher to be kept informed as to the state of the bug moving forward. With that way, if our development team updates the ticket, you'll be notified via email.
fields.summary: Incorrect externalId in AO_82B313_PERSON.ACCOUNT_ID

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When the timeline is fully expanded, the *Teams* list gets cropped and becomes un-scrollable thus making it impossible to select a Team if there are a long list of Teams on the Plan and the desired team isn't at the top of the list.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have a minimum of 3 Teams in Portfolio
# Expand the timeline view

h3. Expected Results

When clicking on *Teams*, I expect to scroll through the list of Teams available on this Plan.

h3. Actual Results

You only see the first Team on the list and can't scroll through (I have 8 teams in this example)

 !Kanban_Plan_-_Portfolio_for_Jira_-_JIRA.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes
This behaviour has been seen on Chrome and Firefox browsers. The size of your window and monitor is also a factor in this.

h3.Workaround
Minimise the timeline view
fields.summary: Teams list gets cropped and not scrollable
A warning should be shown when a subtask lacks resources

fields.description:
h3. Summary

A user creates a ticket in Jira Portfolio with mandatory Component field and commits the ticket, which when falling through in the process to Jira, the component field is empty.
h3. Environment

Portfolio for Jira Cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Step 1
Create a new issue in the Portfolio scope, set a component to this new issue using
the component column in the scope table, go to portfolio commits screen, commit all changes
 # Step 2
each new issue that was added from the scope opens a popup with the empty mandatory component field.

h3. Expected Results

The component field has the value from what has been populated in the Jira Portfolio section
h3. Actual Results

 

You need to set the component value manually
h3. Notes
h3. Workaround

No workaround, need to retype the component as entered in Portfolio
fields.summary: Mandatory component field is not taken from Portfolio ticket creation when committed in Portfolio

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Committing issues in Portfolio showing a bug message for the user:
{quote}
Bummer, something has gone terribly wrong here...
Please try refreshing the page. If the issue continues, please copy and paste the information in the Details button below and send to your JIRA Administrator or Atlassian Support.
{quote}
This occurs when the user does not have "Schedule Issues" permission in the project, but have create issues permission.
An error message occurs, but the issues are created anyway which leaves duplicated issues in Portfolio backlog.

h3. Environment
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a portfolio plan
# Link with a project and remove the Schedule Issue permission from you.
# Create some issues and commit the work in Portfolio.

h3. Expected Results
The issues should be created anyway, since the user have create issues permission.

h3. Actual Results
The issues are created, but Portfolio shows an error on the screen:
{code}
com.atlassian.rm.jpo.core.scenario.common.data.ScenarioCommitException: Scenario commit error


===============
=== Request ===
===============

No request information available

===================
=== Client Info ===
===================

User agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_12_6) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/59.0.3071.115 Safari/537.36 
Local time: Mon Jul 31 2017 17:14:44 GMT-0300 (-03)

===================
=== Plugin Info ===
===================

Plugin build: 1000.30.0
SEN: Unknown

===================
=== System Info ===
===================

JIRA Title: JIRA
JIRA Version: 1000.1145.0
Agile Version: 1000.1145.0
Vertigo: false
{code} 

h3.Workaround
Grant yourself the Schedule Issues permission.
fields.summary: Committing issues in Portfolio showing a bug message for the user but creates the issue anyway (duplicate)

fields.description:
This docs references the following: "How do I see the release start date?", saying the release start date is marked as the grey indicator in the Plan. However, after carefully checking this, if releases in JIRA PO have fixed start dates, the grey indicator can also mark the start of the first Sprint with a date after the fixed release date.
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiraportfoliocloud/using-the-timeline-828785435.html

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1466].
  {panel}

Prerequisites:
* Issue is on a board and assigned to a sprint
* Multiple teams share this board.
* Issue has an assignee in JIRA and the assignee level for the schedule calculation is set to an appropriate level

The issue is assigned to the correct sprint, but not necessarily to the team of with the JIRA assignee.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1562].
  {panel}

*Steps to reproduce:*
 # Have a full localStorage
 # Change the scheduling settings on a Portfolio plan

*Expected:*

The scheduling settings get applied. They are not saved on refresh however.

*Actual*:

The scheduling settings don't get applied at all.
h2. Workaround:

Clear the localStorage of the browser.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In the scope view, Portfolio default fields can be enlarged and narrowed by dragging the column border but select list custom fields cannot be narrowed, only enlarged.
h3. Environment
 * Jira Software cloud
 * Portfolio for Jira cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a select list custom field with a few options and add it to a classic project
 # Create a Portfolio plan using the project used in the previous step as an issue source
 # Add the custom field to the plan by clicking on *(...) > Configure > Custom fields*
 # Go back to the plan, make the field visible using the cog icon next to the scope view
 # Try to narrow the field size by clicking the right side of the column and dragging it to the left side of the screen

h3. Expected Results

The size of the field is narrowed
h3. Actual Results

The size of the field remains the same

!Screen Recording 2019-08-30 at 03.13 PM.gif|width=767,height=391!
h3. Notes
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Select list custom fields cannot be narrowed in the Portfolio scope view

h3. Issue Summary
Removing a skill from a team member causes the checkbox to be marked and the skill is only removed if you commit the change

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Check the video on how to reproduce the bug: https://cl.ly/9c0fe9ccd8d3

h3. Expected Results
The checkbox should not be marked if you select to remove the skill

h3. Actual Results
The skill is removed only if you commit the change for the plan

Require to commit the change in order to have the skill removed

h3. Issue Summary
When calculating a very long plan I hit the planning horizon 30y into the future

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Have a plan with a gigantic epic and a team that can work on it
Hit Calculate

h3. Expected Results
The documentation states that the default planning horizon is 5y

h3. Actual Results
The calculation ends 30y in the future

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1773].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When calculating or loading a Portfolio plan memory consumption peaks significantly or even results in an OutOfMemoryError.

h3. How to reproduce
* create a Portfolio plan and enable placeholder scheduling in the configuration
* create a version in JIRA and set a very distant release date
* create an unestimated issue in Portfolio and set this version
* calculate schedule

h3. Workaround
Remove the invalid release date and recalculate.
If the plan can't be loaded anymore the solution has to be removed from the database table AO_D9132D_SOLUTION where the PLAN_ID is the correct one. If necessary also remove the entries from AO_D9132D_ASSIGNMENT with the corresponding SOLUTION_ID.
fields.summary: Excessive memory consumption if there is a version with very distant release date

fields.summary: Plan setup wizard might throw exception when navigating from the versions to issues step

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Removing an Issue source with a pending change causes the Plan to break.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Plan with two different Project-based Issue sources
# Add a new scenario and create one Issue for Project A and one for Project B (do not commit the changes)
# Configure the Issue sources and remove the second Issue source (Project B)

h3. Expected Results

The source along with all Issues and changes should be removed from the Plan.

h3. Actual Results

The Plan breaks making it unusable.

 !Break_this_plan_-_Portfolio_for_Jira_-_Jira.png|thumbnail! 

{code}
Cannot read property 'defaultIssuePriorityId' of undefined

TypeError: Cannot read property 'defaultIssuePriorityId' of undefined
    at Km (https://jira-frontend-static.prod.public.atl-paas.net/assets-brotli/portfolio-3.119cb6d8813c0e0426eb.8.js:49:740997)
    at https://jira-frontend-static.prod.public.atl-paas.net/assets-brotli/portfolio-3.119cb6d8813c0e0426eb.8.js:49:741357
    at Array.map (<anonymous>)
    at Ym (https://jira-frontend-static.prod.public.atl-paas.net/assets-brotli/portfolio-3.119cb6d8813c0e0426eb.8.js:49:741333)
    at https://jira-frontend-static.prod.public.atl-paas.net/assets-brotli/portfolio-3.119cb6d8813c0e0426eb.8.js:49:1035080
    at a (https://jira-frontend-static.prod.public.atl-paas.net/assets-brotli/vendor~31ecd969.c7bd2edaf25191800c2d.8.js:1:9544)
    at Generator._invoke (https://jira-frontend-static.prod.public.atl-paas.net/assets-brotli/vendor~31ecd969.c7bd2edaf25191800c2d.8.js:1:9297)
    at Generator.forEach.e.<computed> [as next] (https://jira-frontend-static.prod.public.atl-paas.net/assets-brotli/vendor~31ecd969.c7bd2edaf25191800c2d.8.js:1:9901)
    at w (https://jira-frontend-static.prod.public.atl-paas.net/assets-brotli/portfolio-3.119cb6d8813c0e0426eb.8.js:49:632831)
    at Object.i [as cont] (https://jira-frontend-static.prod.public.atl-paas.net/assets-brotli/portfolio-3.119cb6d8813c0e0426eb.8.js:49:633660)
{code}

h3. Workaround

To fix this you must re-configure the Issue sources to add back the removed issue source (Project B) then remove any changes that pertained to Project B. Once removed, you can proceed to remove the Project once more from the Issue sources.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1811].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Set assignees of subtasks might not be correctly imported from JIRA for the Portfolio schedule under the following conditions:
* there is an estimated subtask with an assignee set in JIRA and
* its parent story has no team restriction set in Portfolio and
* the Portfolio data source associated with the parent story is associated with at least two different teams in the plan.
This setup will cause Portfolio to detect an assignment conflict and use the parent's story assignment for the subtask overriding it's assignee.

h3. Workaround
Either set the correct team on the parent story or make sure (if possible) that this team is the only one associated with the data source of the issue.
fields.summary: JIRA assignees on subtasks are ignored in the Portfolio schedule
When using Jira default fields as required on Portfolio while creating issues on Portfolio, the commit does not work as expected.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
This Bug is Cloned from the server version of this BUG JPOSERVER-2703,  With slight differences in the Epic issue type behavior.

When you are creating an issue in an epic the option for initiative hierarchy levels (the level above an epic per portfolio hierarchy configurations) is also listed in the create dialogue as an option to be created as the level below the epic, as the Initiative can be mapped to the Epic as the parent, in turn could lead to additional errors such as a related Server platform BUG [JPOSERVER-2691|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-2691] (Which currently only affects the Server version of the application at this time and not known to affect the cloud version) as a conflict occurs because the initiative cannot be both the parent and child of an Epic at the same time, but similar behavior could occur, and the mapping should not be possible.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# make sure a hierarchical level above epic exists (initiative)
# Navigate to an existing Epic
# Use the "Create issue in epic" option

h3. Expected Results
Only standard issue types that are not mapped to an initiative hierarchy are listed in the issue type field. 

h3. Actual Results
The Initiative issue types are listed as avaliable issue types, and the Initiative can be selected and created as a child of the Epic
 
h3. Notes
As the Initiative is considered a standard issue type but mapped to the higher hierarchy levels by portfolio the mappings would be possible if Portfolio was disabled, so an additional Expectation could be that a warning or error would occur when a initiative issue type is selected noting the issue types are invalid because of hierarchy configurations

h3.Workaround
You can use the following JQL to identify issue in this state:
{code}
issuetype = "initiative"  AND "Epic Link" is not EMPTY 
{code}
perform Bulk Update to remove the Epic link

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Portfolio scheduling algorithm is trying to assign work to releases with fixed dates even when those dates are before the plan start.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new project.
 # Create 3 new issues on this project.
 # Add estimation to those issues.
 # Create a new release on this project.
 # Move 2 of those issues to this release.
 # Complete those 2 issues.
 # Complete the release.
 # Create a new plan and add the project as issue source.
 # The issue that is still open will be associated to the completed release.
 # The release will show as overbooked.

Here is a video that can help to reproduce this behavior: [https://cl.ly/4b6bb32da77c]
h3. Actual Results

Portfolio scheduling algorithm is assigning issues to releases with fixed dates even when those dates are before the plan start.
h3. Expected Results

Portfolio scheduling algorithm is should not assign issues to completed releases.
h3. Workaround

None.
fields.summary: Portfolio scheduling algorithm is trying to assign work to releases with fixed dates even when those dates are before the plan start.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Wrong scheduling behaviour due to estimate rounding 

h3. Environment
Portfolio for Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have velocity of 35h/week configured for a Kanban team member in the plan, which means that 1d equals 7h.
# Have issue *A* with an estimate of 1d = 7h and with a high priority
# Have issue *B* with an estimate of 1d = 7h and with a priority just after A
# Have issue *C* with an estimate of 0.5d = 3.5h

h3. Expected Results
Issue *A* is scheduled to be completed in one day and after this *B* is scheduled

h3. Actual Results
*A* is scheduled to be completed in 1d and a small fraction of the second day. This makes it possible for the highest ranked issue *C* to be scheduled on the second day as it has an estimate small enough to fill in this gap (even though *C* has lower priority then *B*).  
 
h3. Notes


h3.Workaround
-
fields.summary: Wrong scheduling behaviour due to estimate rounding

fields.description:
h2. Environment
Jira Cloud
Portfolio for Cloud

h2. Problem
The dependency report does not list dependencies of a certain issue link type, even though it is properly configured in Portfolio's _Dependency Settings_

This happens for dependencies that are swapped, i.e., the dependency type description reads
bq. If A <something> B, then B is scheduled before A

and not _...then A is scheduled before B_

These dependencies are still properly respected by the scheduling algorithm and also show up in the issue details page and schedule tooltip but they are missing in the dependency report.

h2. Steps to Reproduce
* Create a plan based on a board
* Add a dependency (Blocks, for example) to one issue and commit it to Jira
* Recalculate your plan
* Go to Portfolio settings > Portfolio Dependencies
* Next to the dependency name, click Swap in order to make the settings be like If A blocks B then B is scheduled before A
* Click the Save changes button
* Go back to your plan and click Calculate button to recalculate your plan
* Go to Reports > Dependencies

h2. Workaround
There is no workaround at the moment.
fields.summary: Dependency report does not show swapped dependencies

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1222].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When JIRA Portfolio creates a plan export, it produces a UTF-8 encoded file. This is the expected behaviour. Subsequently importing this file uses the System File Encoding. This introduces a problem with some characters in various encodings as the characters become corrupt. 


h3. Environment
JIRA 6.4.12, 
JIRA Portfolio 1.10.4


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set a JIRA environment up to use: {{-Dfile.encoding=cp1252"}} encoding.
# Create a Plan which includes characters which vary in encoding. 
# Export this plan. 
# Confirm the plan opens as a UTF-8 Encoded file using a text editor. 
# Import the plan. 
# Observe the characters become corrupt. JIRA Portfolio has treated the file as a 'cp1252 encoded file. 


h3. Expected Results
JIRA Portfolio should treat the file as a UTF-8 file on import and export. 


h3. Actual Results
JIRA Portfolio corrupts some characters, when the system file encoding is not  UTF-8. 
For Example: 
{code}
这是一个例子
{code}

Becomes:
{code}
è¿™æ˜¯ä¸€ä¸ªä¾‹å­
{code}


h3. Workaround
Set the File Encoding to UTF-8 in JIRA. 
This can be done by adding the property {{-Dfile.encoding=utf-8"}}: by following the instructions in: [Setting Properties and options on startup|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/setting-properties-and-options-on-startup-120007.html]. 

Note: This will not fix existing corrupted plan templates, that have been previously imported/exported and contain corrupted characters when accessed with a text editor using UTF-8 encoding.
fields.summary: Importing Portfolio Plan treats file encoding as system encoding

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Converting issues to Epic in if they had an Epic Link set will not remove the Epic Link. Due to that, when you set a Parent for these issues, they will not display in the parent "Child issues" panel.

h3. Environment
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an issue and set an Epic for it.
# Convert this issue to Epic
# Set a parent link for this Epic

h3. Expected Results
Should display under the parent Child issues

h3. Actual Results
Does not display.
 
h3.Workaround
Convert the issue from Epic to another issue type, remove the Parent Link that exists in the Issue, set an Epic Link and then remove it. After all this, you can convert the issue back to Epic and assign a Parent.
fields.summary: Issues converted to Epic with an existing Epic Link do not display in Child issues.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

As per issue summary, single user picker custom fields does not show value even if the field contains a user value in issue view. In the scope view, the user picker field will show as blank.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a single user picker custom field in JIRA.
 # Add it into the issue view screen and pick a random user as field value.
 # Go to a Portfolio plan and include this custom field into the plan via \{...}> Configure > Custom Field.

 # The user picker field will now show at the scope view.

h3. Expected Results

The user picker field should show the user value.
h3. Actual Results

The user picker field does not show any user value despite having a user selected at the issue view screen.

!image-2020-05-07-01-04-52-789.png|thumbnail!

!image-2020-05-07-01-05-24-279.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

Enable the *Improved Planning Interface* in the plan settings.
fields.summary: Single user picker custom field does not show value in scope view

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Different combinations of the following environmental factors can cause the scope layout to break:
 * Zooming in your browser
 * Windows "Change the size of text, apps and other items" option being increased

Depending on the extent of these scalings, the problem can occur at different screen resolutions, not just necessarily high resolution screens.
h3. Environment

Seems to occur most often with Chrome, but has happened with other browsers.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have the specs above
 # Go to Portfolio Scope view

h3. Expected Results

All issues are lined up
h3. Actual Results

The layout is messed up and issues are not aligned
h3. Workaround
 * Using Chrome developer tools and adding "clear: both" to the ".clearfix:before, .clearfix:after" sector makes it render properly.
 * Un-zoom your browser back to 100% if zoomed in
 * Un-scale your Windows scaling to default if scaled up
fields.summary: Portfolio Scope view has messed up layout when zoomed or scaled

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If a user adds more than one link of the same type in an issue, the Portfolio Dependency Report will show only one entry

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Configure all the issue linking option in the Portfolio's *Dependency settings* 
# Create a classic project and add issues to it
# Create a Portfolio plan using the board of the project created as the issue source
# Pickup one issue and add a link to 2 different issues using the type *relates to*
# Access the Portfolio plan and re-calculate it
# Click the *Reports* tab in Portfolio and selects the *Dependency Report* option

h3. Expected Results

The 2 dependencies are displayed

h3. Actual Results

Only one of the dependencies is visible in the report.

 !Screen Shot 2020-05-04 at 1.05.44 PM.png|thumbnail! 
 !Screen Shot 2020-05-04 at 1.04.57 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Creates the dependencies using the other issue. For example:

* You have issues A, B, and C
* Add the dependency (link) between A and B from the A view
* Add the dependency (link) between A and C from the C view, not from A view
fields.summary: The Dependency report doesn't show all dependencies of the same type for an issue

fields.summary: Setting Completed issues days to 0 gives DataValidationException

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1721].
  {panel}

By assigning a member to an issue, deleting that member from the team/plan, the issue then will still have that member assigned, even though it is not visible. The issue assignee import will now not be able to override this hidden assigned member.

Workaround:
 * Assign a new member to that ticket. Click "Apply"
 * Open up member assignment, click "Clear selected items", then click "Apply"
 * Recalculate
fields.summary: Issues that were assigned a team member who was deleted will not import from JIRA issue assignees

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When you have multiple absence in a specific team member, if there is any existing exception, it will be duplicated somehow.

(i) This might be causing performance issue if you have a lot of absence and exception. As it took resources processing the duplicated data as well.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a team member under a Team
# Set an absence and exception into this team member
# Add another absence to this specific team member

h3. Expected Results
There will be only one exception into under this team member

h3. Actual Results
There is a duplicate amount of exception under this team member which means there are 2 same exception right now
fields.summary: Duplicate Exceptions for Team member when there is Multiple Absence

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1291].
  {panel}

When defining data sources that include some subtasks but not their parents may result in a scheduling error, if the subtask has an issue link defined that is configured to be a Portfolio dependency.

Workaround: adapt the data source to also include the parent of all subtasks or remove the issue link type from the Portfolio Dependency configuration.

fields.summary: Scheduling error in Live plans having subtasks without parent imported

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1381].
  {panel}

I had previously imported issues (Epics, Stories and Tasks) from a live project into a "Sandpit" project in our Jira Cloud instance. These were given new issue names on the import so that they are completely separate from the project that they were imported from (SAN-1, SAN-2 etc).

Before trying Jira Portfolio Labs, I had previously added a new Issue Type called "Initiative" and associated it with the Sandpit project.

When subsequently trying out Jira Portfolio Labs and setting up a plan to import the issues from the Sandpit project, everything appeared to work ok and epics, stories and tasks were imported. There were, of course, no initiatives in the project at this point.

Portfolio Labs was configured to allow Initiatives in the Scope. When attempting to create new initiatives, this worked correctly. However, when trying to commit the changes back to Jira using "Review and commit changes" in Jira Portfolio Labs, the following exception occurred:

fields.summary: Exception when attempting to commit the creation of new Initiatives or Stories in Jira Portfolio Labs

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1471].
  {panel}

Portfolio 2.0 is supposed to run on JIRA Server 6.3 - 7.1.8

We are running JIRA software v6.4.12#64027 (agile 6.7.0) 

When you attempt to configure Portfolio Hierarchy Configuration or Portfolio Dependencies

you get and error:

"Please install dependencies
Portfolio for JIRA could not find software necessary to run.
Please install or update to JIRA Agile (6.7.12 or higher).
If you need help installing software or think this message is wrong, please contact your JIRA administrators."
fields.summary: Cannot configure Portfolio missing dependency Jira Agile 6.7.12

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-486].
  {panel}

Hi!
We created custom sprints for a team. Portfolio automatically assigned stories to sprints. But when the first sprint time was over, Portfolio didn't move stories to the next sprint and didn't signalized that we failed.
Could anybody explain why, please? What is the reason of using Portfolio if it doesn't signalize about such failure and doesn't move stories on and on.
http://prntscr.com/868iaj - printscreen
The same situation is with automatic sprints (sprint1 ... sprintN) http://prntscr.com/868mak
fields.summary: Stories aren't moved from sprint to sprint after one is finished

h4. Summary
When exporting issues from issue navigator to CSV, the exported file shows package class for Team field instead of Team name or Team ID

h4. Steps to reproduce
# Associate issue with team in Portfolio live plan
# Go to issue navigator to retrieve the issues associated with team
# Export as CSV (include Team field)

h4. Expected Result
CSV file will show team name or team ID under Team column

h4. Actual Result
CSV file shows package class {{com.atlassian.jpo.team.data.DefaultTeam@dc88b95}} instead
fields.summary: Export issue (from issue navigator) does not retrieve correct value for Team field

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The capacity view of the scheduling result shows incorrect numbers for planned and available capacities for resources of Kanban teams.
This error occurs  if there are at least two teams in the plan which are linked to Scrum boards with active sprints with different start dates on them.
The capacity calculation may mix up the start times for some teams and get shifted. This situation can easily be spotted by having gaps in the Kanban capacity or overbooked values in the scheduling for a Kanban team.

h3. Reproduce

* * create two Scrum boards with active sprints on them (e.g. 13/Mar/17 - 29/Mar/17 and 1/Mar/17 - 29/Mar/17).
* create a plan with two Kanban teams linked to to the created Scrum boards
* calculate a schedule and switch to capacity view

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Kanban team scheduling starts in the past and shows shifted capacity values in the schedule

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Although the Progress bar looks completed, customers see a message 'x out of xxx points in total remaining' but the *Completed* Story Points appears as the issue is already 100% Done.
 !Screen Shot 2018-12-12 at 18.30.05.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an issue with more than one child
# Add estimatives to these children
# Complete one of them, and then you'll see the problem

You'll see the message that you still have some stories points remaining, but in the Completed Story Points you'll alse see as you've already done all stories points.

h3. Expected Results
Completed and Remaining values are calculated properly

h3. Workaround
Contact [Atlassian Support|https://support.atlassian.com/contact/] to apply the workaround for you.
fields.summary: Progress bar is not working properly

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The first time after the installation of Portfolio the Manage plan page shows a *Create plan* button. This, however, yields an error. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install *Portfolio* 
# Click *Portfolio* > *Manage Plan* 
# Click *Create Plan*

* 

h3. Expected Results
The plan is created

h3. Actual Results
An error is shown:
* !Bug report create plan portfolio.png|thumbnail! 
 

h3.Workaround
Use the *Create Plan* at top right.
fields.summary: First time Create plan button yields an error in Portfolio

fields.description:
h4. Summary
Schedule range filter filters out issues in-range if their target dates fall outside the range

h4. Steps to reproduce
# Setup a plan with the following issues
||ISSUE||Scheduled start||Scheduled end||Target start||Target end||
|ISSUE-A|11/04/2017|19/05/2017|09/03/2017|19/05/2017|
|ISSUE-C|11/04/2017|19/05/2017|18/04/2017|20/04/2017|
# Set schedule range: 01/04/2017 - 30/04/2017

h4. Expected result
The capacity will include ISSUE-A and ISSUE C, as Portfolio's schedule range should include issues when EITHER the scheduled start/end OR the target start/end match the scheduling range filter 

h4. Actual Result
The capacity will change and filter out ISSUE-A as its target start/end falls outside schedule range
fields.summary: Schedule range filter filters out issues in-range issues if their target dates fall outside the range

h3. Summary
An error message occurs when calculating the schedule of a LivePlan.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
Investigating

h3. Expected Results
Calculation ends and the schedule is shown.

h3. Actual Results
Error indication window.

The detailed error message (and the log file) includes the following stacktrace:
{noformat}
Caused by java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: time limit must not be negative but was-1
at com.google.common.base.Preconditions.checkArgument:122
at com.radiantminds.roadmap.scheduling.algo.construct.actset.TimeLimitedTerminationCondition.<init>:22

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1611].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

When a JIRA Portfolio Plan is connected to an existing project where, in order to create an issue, the following fields are *Required* under that Project's Field Configuration:

* *Description* field
* Another field, such as a test custom field

When committing a change, such as a new Epic/Story/etc., the Set Required Fields Screen will be brought up so that the user may populate that other required field. In the process, the *Description* field is also brought up but it does not retain the description that may have been added in Portfolio.



The issue cannot be created without the user repopulating the Description again since it is a required field.

h3. Environment
* JIRA 7.1.6
* Portfolio 2.0.6

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a new project
# Create a new custom field (e.g. "Test", which is a Single Line Text Field)
# Configure the project's field configuration so that *Description* and *Test* are +Required+
# Create a new plan and associate it with this project
# Create a new Epic and give it a description in Portfolio
# Commit the change

At this point, you will find that the issue isn't automatically created since the user needs to populate *Test*. *Description* will be blank. Cannot proceed with creating the issue until *Description* is populated again.

h3. Expected Results

Description should be retained from Portfolio into the Set Required Fields screen during the commit. Completing the commit should create the issue with the Description.

h3. Actual Results
Description is not retained in the Set Required Fields screen during the commit.
 
h3.Workaround
Either:

1. Repopulate the description at the Set Required Fields screen
or
2. Set Description to be Optional in the project's field configuration, which will prevent it from coming up during the Set Required Fields screen. The description is retained at the time of issue creation this way.
fields.summary: Requiring Description and another field causes description to be lost when committing changes

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When users add value to the "Team" field to an Issue, the "Issue Update" event triggers, but when users remove/delete the value of the "Team" field, the "Issue Update" event does not trigger.

This behavior can be observed using Jira automation apps such as "ScriptRunner" or "Automation for Jira"

h3. Environment

Jira Software
Portfolio for Jira

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create shared teams in Portfolio
# Add the field "Team" to the screen of a Jira project
# Install the Jira app "Script Runner" and create a listener as described [here|https://scriptrunner.adaptavist.com/latest/jira/listeners.html]. The script below can be used to add comments to the issue when it's edited:
#* {code}def projectKey = 'SCRUM'

// Restrict this script to only run against issues in one project
if (issue.fields.project.key != projectKey) {
    return
}

def author = issue.fields.creator.displayName

// Add a plain-text comment, see https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/cloud/#api/2/issue/{issueIdOrKey}/comment-addComment
// for more details
def commentResp = post("/rest/api/2/issue/${issue.key}/comment")
    .header('Content-Type', 'application/json')
    .body([
            body: """Thank you ${author} for creating a support request.

We'll respond to your query within 24hrs.

In the meantime, please read our documentation: http://example.com/documentation"""
    ])
    .asObject(Map)

assert commentResp.status == 201{code}
# Set a value to the field "Team" in an issue of the selected project
# Remove the value of the field "Team"

h3. Expected Results

Two comments are added to the issue used in the tests and Script Runner logs show 2 issue update events.

h3. Actual Results

Only one comment is added and Script Runner logs show only 1 issue update events.

h3. Notes


h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: The Portfolio "Team" field does not trigger the "Issue Update" event when the field's value is removed/deleted

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1438].
  {panel}

*Problem:*
You have a Live Plan and from there assign issues to a release that exists in JIRA, you do not commit this change but keep it pending. Next, you delete this version in JIRA. This will clean up all fix version assignments in JIRA but the pending fix version change in Portfolio is not affected by this operation.

Therefore, the issues are now exclusively assigned to a release that is not included in your plan - it has been deleted. Consequently, these issues are excluded from your plan (if issues are only assigned to releases that are not included in your plan, we exclude them). The still active scenario assignment has priority over JIRA assignments (otherwise you could never filter for changes active in the scenario etc.)

However, after refreshing your page, the pending changes for these issues disappear and they are just gone without a trace.

*Workaround*
At the moment, the best thing you can do is to create another plan based on the same issue sources and releases. However, any pending changes on the affected issues cannot be brought back to the new plan. 

We are working on a solution.
fields.summary: Issues that are scenario-assigned to a version that has been deleted in JIRA disappear from Live Plans

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1293].
  {panel}

Description:
I have multiple sources, each of which is a board.

To reproduce the issue:
1. Go to Schedule Settings, select Line: Global, Grouping: None

Result:
"This view is only available if all teams are on the same schedule."

My teams are on the same schedule, they all started on 9 Feb, and all last 2 weeks.

I noticed that on the graphical schedule, the left boundary of the Epics (or Stories, it doesn't matter) of one of the teams, appears on 8 Feb, i.e. the day BEFORE they actually started the sprint. All the others are in line, slightly to the right, on 9 Feb, as I would expect.

Here are the start/end dates from the Sprint Report for the current sprint on all the projects.

    Team 1: 09/Feb/16 10:31 AM - 23/Feb/16 10:31 AM
    Team 2: 09/Feb/16 3:08 PM - 23/Feb/16 3:08 PM
    Team 3: 09/Feb/16 2:48 PM - 23/Feb/16 2:48 PM
    Team 4: 09/Feb/16 3:32 PM - 23/Feb/16 3:32 PM

Team 1 is the one that JPO is showing started on 8 Feb, and therefore probably why it thinks the teams are not on the same schedule.

Is there a date boundary issue? Note that I am in New Zealand. The above times are correct local times; JPO may be doing something funky when it tries to work out dates.
fields.summary: Teams not deemed to be on same schedule in Live plans, but they are

fields.description:
h2. Problem
When there is a scenario-dependency (i.e., a pending change on the issue's dependencies) between _Story A_ and _Story B_ in Scenario X of Plan 1, this dependency will impact the scheduling result of Scenario Y in Plan 1 (given _Story A_ and _Story B_ are part of that scenario). Furthermore, if these stories are part of Plan 2, the scheduling result will also be impacted by this scenario dependency.

h2. Expected Behaviour
The scenario-dependency only impacts the scheduling result of Scenario X in Plan 1 (b/c that is where the pending change is)

h2. Actual Behaviour
Every scenario and plan that pulls in the two stories is impacted by that scenario-dependency that should be local to Scenario X.
fields.summary: Scenario dependencies on a plan leak into other plans
Epics Lose Initiative link on Import

fields.description:
h2. Problem description
In situations where there are target dates on a story that does not get scheduled (either b/c it is unestimated, has an explicit estimate of 0 or some scheduling violation) but does have sub-tasks and scheduling of unestimated items is turned off, viewing the schedule grouped by projects (or teams / resources) causes a bummer message to show up.
h2. Expected behaviour
The schedule can be rendered properly with the configured grouping applied.
h2. Actual behaviour
A bummer message shows up and the schedule remains empty
h2. Workaround
Either disable grouping (switch to _Global_ for _Line_ and _None_ for _Grouping_ options) - OR - remove the target dates from the story - OR - make sure the story actually gets scheduled - OR - turn unestimated items scheduling to _Based on target dates_
fields.summary: Error when viewing schedule by project and an unestimated/unscheduled story has target dates and sub-tasks configured

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When navigating through Portfolio screens a pop-up window showing the message "Leave site? Changes you made may not be saved." is constantly displayed
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access Portfolio and click "View all plans"
 # Access any plan

h3. Expected Results

You access the plan without problems
h3. Actual Results

A pop-up window showing the message "Leave site? Changes you made may not be saved." appears and you have to click "Leave"

!Screen Recording 2020-03-18 at 08.11 PM.gif|width=817,height=424!
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

fields.description:
*Errors:*
A timeout on the client request could occur when doing an "Update plan from date".
!Screen Shot 2015-06-30 at 9.53.52 AM.png|thumbnail!

*Notes:*
On the client the timeout error appears, although the server-side operation will still going on until it has been finished.

*Workaround:*
Wait, and at some point the operation will be finished on the server side. That message will pop-up, then refresh the browser page after some time and the updated values should be visible in there.

h3. Summary
Portfolio scope loses formatting at high zoom settings.
If the user set a high zoom setting in the browser, or a system wide one, specially related with the characters in the text, then the Portfolio Scope will lose formatting:

JIRA Cloud

The formatting is broken as shown in the image above.

Disable any zoom settings you may have.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In cases where remapping an issue's type leads to invalidating existing parent-child relationships, the application of the "Only open issues" still returns the parent issue if done in case it has at least one former open child.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Make sure you have an additional issue type mapped to the epic hierarchy level - let's call it _"Topic"_ - in Portfolio's hierarchy configuration
 # Create an Topic
 # Add a story as a child of this topic
 # Close the topic (transition to Done status), leave the story open
 # In Portfolio's hierarchy configuration, map the Topic issue type to a hierarchy level above the Epic level
 # Create a Portfolio plan that pulls in the two issues you created
 # Filter for "Only open issues"

h3. Expected Results
* You only see the open story

h3. Actual Results
* The completed Topic (formerly epic) also shows up

h3. Workaround
* Find the former children of the parent and review their parent links; make sure to clear the association to the former parent. This can be done from Portfolio's scope table details view.
fields.summary: Filtering for only open issues in Portfolio shows done issues w/o children in certain edge cases
Error when performing "Update from date" on a blank plan

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When updating the Fix Version on Portfolio Plan for an issue and committing the change, it will overwrite the current value from Jira.
However, in Jira, you can have multiple Fix Versions on the field.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a plan based on a project
# On Jira, create an issue and create some Fix Versions
# Add two fix versions to the issue in Jira
# At the plan, reload the information (calculate) and set a different Fix Version
# Commit the change
# On Jira, the information was replaced by the new value

h3. Expected Results
The Plan should prompt to select an option to add a new value or overwrite all the information

h3. Actual Results
The Plan overwrite the entire field and does not give an option to have multiple values on Fix Version (Release) field

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Updating the Fix Version on the plan causes to overwrite the Fix Version on Jira instead of adding a new value to the field

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The complete button will be either hidden or overlapped by the filter in the plan when a long string of Project and release being used in the filter 

h3. Environment
JIRA Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a version and project with a long string of characters ie. Product Development and Marketing (Top Management department)
 # Create a portfolio plan and filter the plan by the project and filter that you have just created

h3. Expected Results
The complete button is not overlapped by the filter

h3. Actual Results
The complete button will be either hidden or overlapped by the filter 
 !image-2019-09-27-11-40-22-700.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes
Even dragging around the sidebar would not get around the issue

h3. Workaround
Hide the sidebar to see the complete button
fields.summary: Plan filter overlaps complete button when a long string of Project and release being used in the filter

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1819].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When showing a custom field using the Date Picker in Portfolio > Scope, the date is incorrect. 

Ex: Field in JIRA Issue View shows 07/Feb/17, however in Portfolio the field shows as 06/Feb/17

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a custom field using the Date Picker
# Associate with screens in your given project
# Create an issue and populate the custom field with a date value
# Import Project issues in Portfolio
# Go to Configure > Custom Fields
# Add the newly added custom field
# View the field in Portfolio > Scope

h3. Expected Results
The same date as shown in JIRA issue

h3. Actual Results
The value shown is off by one day

h3.Workaround
No workaround
fields.summary: Custom Field using Date Picker Shows Incorrect Date in Portfolio
